column4: i'm having trouble with my video settings, it keeps triggering an error when i try to set my visual effects -> anything above "none".
also, it's not detecting my second monitor
when I choose a different type of visual effects it does a searching for available drivers...and than reloads the screen and triggers an "desktop effects could not be enabled" error
dvi
so the cable is a hdmi to dvi conversion, the screen supports dvi, the laptop supports hdmi
it might be vga, whats the newer one?
dvi is the newer one, im pretty sure its dvi
im new to ubuntu jt so, I don't think so?
oh, yes I did
and once I installed the proprietary drivers it started giving me the visual effects error
because you probably did it wrong.. did you download from nvidia and install using a web based tutorial?
i used ubuntu to install
i went to system > admin > additional drivers
and it installed it automatically
what card do you have?
thats a good question, its a laptop, i know its an nvidea i just forget the model
sudo lshw will list all your hardware.. type that into a terminal.. then with the output look for reference to it.
when i try to go into my nvidia settings its saying "Youd o not appear to be using the nvidia x driver. please edit your x configuration file (run nvidia-xconfig) as root and restart he server
ok.. then open a terminal and type "sudo nvidia-xconfig" without the quotes.
done
imma restart pc quick
k
